intro: Meehania urticifolia var. henryi, commonly known as Henry's stinging nettle, is a variant of the stinging nettle species native to China. It is characterized by its serrated leaves and the presence of hollow,螫针-like hairs that release irritants when touched. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. This variant is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for various health benefits.
